com.mwdiamond.fansi

Class AnsiUtils.ProgressBar

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mwdiamond.fansi.AnsiUtils.ProgressBar
  • Enclosing class:
    AnsiUtils

    public static class AnsiUtils.ProgressBar
extends java.lang.Object
    A text progress bar that will overwrite itself when updated, presenting the user with dynamic yet concise visualization of the application's current progress.

    This class is not thread-safe; multi-threaded applications should generally have a single thread responsible for output, otherwise access to this class needs to be synchronized.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AnsiUtils.ProgressBar.Builder
      Builder for custom AnsiUtils.ProgressBar instances.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      void finish()
      Fills the progress bar (i.e.
      void increment()
      Increment the progress bar by one step.
      void remove()
      Clears the progress bar from the screen leaving the cursor at the beginning of the current line.
      void updateProgress(int currentStep)
      Set the progress bar's current progress.
      void updateSteps(int currentStep, int totalSteps)

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • increment

        public void increment()
        Increment the progress bar by one step.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the progress bar is already finished (i.e. 100% or n/n)

      • updateProgress

        public void updateProgress(int currentStep)
        Set the progress bar's current progress.
        Parameters:
        currentStep - the number of steps completed (filled on the progress bar)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if currentStep is negative
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if currentStep is not in the range [0, totalSteps]

      • updateSteps

        public void updateSteps(int currentStep,
                        int totalSteps)
        Updates the progress bar, setting both the current number of steps and the total number of steps that will be completed.
        Parameters:
        currentStep - the number of steps completed (filled on the progress bar)
        totalSteps - the total number of steps to be completed (width of the progress bar)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if currentStep is negative, totalSteps is not positive, or currentStep is not in the range [0, totalSteps]

      • remove

        public void remove()
        Clears the progress bar from the screen leaving the cursor at the beginning of the current line. This is a terminating operation; the progress bar can no longer be updated.

      • finish

        public void finish()
        Fills the progress bar (i.e. updateProgress(totalSteps)) and moves the cursor to the next line, leaving the completed progress bar on the screen. This is a terminating operation; the progress bar can no longer be updated.
